alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 03 at 2:49AM MDT until November 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. * WHERE...Ferris/Seminoe/Shirley Mountains, Shirley Basin, Central Carbon County, Laramie Valley, South Laramie Range and South Laramie Range Foothills. * WHEN...From Friday evening through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Widespread strong crosswinds could create hazardous travel for all motorists on Interstate 80 and north to south oriented highways such as Highway 287...especially for light weight and high profile vehicles...including light load semis and those towing camper trailers.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.

area.areaDesc: Central Carbon County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; Shirley Basin; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
